stories.text:
I am engineer by skills but one missing skill I have repeatedly found is marketing.

How do I learn 0 - 40% of marketing? I want to understand basics and be able to market a simple product.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you learn marketing

stories.text:
Hi, I've had a few jobs as a web developer, mostly in startups. I spent ~2 years in college doing software engineering(mostly C, algorithms/DS, web dev, but I started coding a long time before college) I got offered a job before graduating and needed the money so I couldn't stay in school.

Do you think if I spent 6 months or +1 year on MOOCs/Books/personal projects, I could land a decent job as a junior ML engineer or something similar?Not at a FAANG or anything like that. Just a decent job.

Or do you think it's absolutely necessary to go through a Master/PhD to get a decent job in that field? I honestly don't think there is a (great)future in web dev plus it's starting to bore me, so I want to switch.

Btw I'm based in western Europe.

Thanks
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it realistic to want to get a job in AI/ML/DL without any degree?

stories.text:
A while back on Youtube, quite a lot of videos popped up[0][1][2] about Skoda sticking their own logo over the Volkswagen logo on their engine covers. Then, this craze suddenly dropped off and I never heard anything about it.

Those videos also amassed a peculiar amount of dislikes, suggesting this was either fake or people were very unhappy with Skoda about this.

I've always been quite curious about this, and whether or not other manufacturers / companies partake in the same (seemingly quite lazy) branding schemes. I suppose what I'm asking is: is this just standard practice, or frowned upon by the industry, and are these videos fake?

[0]: https://youtu.be/q8tur1sUvhc?t=58

[1]: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s-7PaqS2gZA

[2]: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Etf3yMznKN4
stories.title: Ask HN: Does Skoda stick their logo over the VW logo on their engine covers?
